meanings.definition: To establish a relationship of parentage or descent.
meanings.sent1: The baby bird was filiated with its mother, learning to fly from her.
meanings.sent2: The family tree filiated the generations, showing who came before.
meanings.sent3: The little acorn was filiated to the mighty oak tree, feeling proud of its heritage.
meanings.sent4: The river filiated with the ocean, carrying its essence downstream.
meanings.sent5: The ancient scroll filiated the history of the kingdom, preserving the past for future generations.

meanings.definition: To be affiliated or associated with a larger organization or group.
meanings.sent1: The local club filiated with the national organization, gaining support and resources.
meanings.sent2: She filiated herself with the charity, helping those in need.
meanings.sent3: The little shop filiated with the big chain, attracting more customers with its new name.
meanings.sent4: The small island filiated with the mainland, sharing resources and culture.
meanings.sent5: The student filiated with the academic society, expanding their knowledge and network.
